top_categories.workout_context: 50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
The Divide's Michigan rolling, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
At The Divide, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of The Divide. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic The Divide's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
50 miles on Michigan rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on Michigan rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on Michigan rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At The Divide, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Base fitness for The Divide. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Torque for headwinds and Michigan rolling gravel. When cadence drops below 70rpm, muscular strength keeps the watts up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for The Divide’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The Divide requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on michigan rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: michigan rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of michigan rolling gravel in Manton, Michigan.
